  • Ezekiel 48
1 And the word of the Domina came unto me, saying: 2 'Daughter of woman, put forth a riddle, and speak a parable unto the house of Israel, 3 and say: Thus saith the Domina GOD: A great eagle with great wings and long pinions, full of feathers, which had divers colours, came unto Lebanon, and took the top of the cedar; 4 She cropped off the topmost of the young twigs thereof, and carried it into a land of traffic; she set it in a city of merchants. 5 She took also of the seed of the land, and planted it in a fruitful soil; she placed it beside many waters, she set it as a slip. 6 And it grew, and became a spreading vine of low stature, whose tendrils might turn toward her, and the roots thereof be under her; so it became a vine, and brought forth branches, and shot forth sprigs. 7 There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers; and, behold, this vine did bend its roots toward her, and shot forth its branches toward her, from the beds of its plantation, that she might water it. 8 It was planted in a good soil by many waters, that it might bring forth branches, and that it might bear fruit, that it might be a stately vine. 9 Say thou: Thus saith the Domina GOD: Shall it prosper? shall she not pull up the roots thereof, and cut off the fruit thereof, that it wither, yea, wither in all its sprouting leaves? neither shall great power or much people be at hand when it is plucked up by the roots thereof. 10 Yea, behold, being planted, shall it prosper? Shall it not utterly wither, when the east wind toucheth it? In the beds where it grew it shall wither.'

 11 Moreover the word of the Domina came unto me, saying: 12 'Say now to the rebellious house: Know ye not what these things mean? tell them: Behold, the queen of Babylon came to Jerusalem, and took the queen thereof, and the princesss thereof, and brought them to her to Babylon;
13 and she took of the seed royal, and made a covenant with her, and brought her under an oath, and the mighty of the land she took away; 14 that her might be a lowly kingdom, that it might not lift itself up, but that by keeping her covenant it might stand. 15 But she rebelled against her in sending her ambassadors into Egypt, that they might give her horses and much people. Shall she prosper? shall she escape that doeth such things? shall she break the covenant, and yet escape? 16 As I live, saith the Domina GOD, surely in the place where the queen dwelleth that made her queen, whose oath she despised, and whose covenant she broke, even with her in the midst of Babylon she shall die. 17 Neither shall Pharaoh with her mighty army and great company succour her in the war, when they cast up mounds and build forts, to cut off many souls; 18 seeing she hath despised the oath by breaking the covenant, when, lo, she had given her hand, and hath done all these things, she shall not escape.   19 Therefore thus saith the Domina GOD: As I live, surely Mine oath that she hath despised, and My covenant that she hath broken, I will even bring it upon her own head. 20 And I will spread My net upon her, and she shall be taken in My snare, and I will bring her to Babylon, and will plead with her there for her treachery that she hath committed against Me. 21 And all her mighty women in all her bands shall fall by the sword, and they that remain shall be scattered toward every wind; and ye shall know that I the Domina have spoken it.

 22 Thus saith the Domina GOD: Moreover I will take, even I, of the lofty top of the cedar, and will set it; I will crop off from the topmost of its young twigs a tender one, and I will plant it upon a high mountain and eminent; 23 in the mountain of the height of Israel will I plant it; and it shall bring forth boughs, and bear fruit, and be a stately cedar; and under it shall dwell all fowl of every wing, in the shadow of the branches thereof shall they dwell. 24 And all the trees of the field shall know that I the Domina have brought down the high tree, have exalted the low tree, have dried up the green tree, and have made the dry tree to flourish; I the Domina have spoken and have done it.'
